Komnas HAM: Banyak Orang dengan Celana Cingkrang atau Cadar Tak Radikal
03 Nov 2019, 15:13 by Rakhmad Hidayatulloh Permana
Jakarta - Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi menuai kontroversi lantaran memunculkan wacana pelarangan cadar dan celana cingkrang di instansi pemerintah. Komnas HAM ingatkan soal hak mengekspresikan atribut sesuai dengan agama yang diyakini.
"Saya hanya ingin mengingatkan pejabat negara bahwa kewajiban negara adalah menghormati dan melindungi hak asasi dan kemerdekaan individu, termasuk kemerdekaan untuk mengekspresikan apa yang diyakininya sebagai ajaran agamanya," ujar Ketua Komnas HAM Ahmad Taufan Damanik kepada wartawan, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Taufan menjelaskan hak mengekspresikan keyakinan memang bukan hak asasi yang absolut. Kendati demikian, regulasi pengaturan atasnya harus didasari alasan yang kuat.
"Kemerdekaan individu yang asasi dalam hal ini kebebasan mengekspresikan keyakinan memang bukan hak asasi yang absolut. Namun regulasi untuk pengaturan dan pembatasannya mesti didasari alasan yang kuat. Dalam standar internasional, dikenal Prinsip Siracusa namanya," tuturnya.
Untuk diketahui, prinsip Siracusa adalah pembatasan atau pengurangan hak asasi yang dilakukan atas dasar pertimbangan keselamatan moral bangsa. Bisa juga atas alasan keselamatan dan keamanan nasional atau yang setara dengan itu.

Komnas HAM: Many People in Cingkrang Pants or Non-Radical Veils
03 Nov 2019, 15:13 by Rakhmad Hidayatulloh Permana
Jakarta - Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi has caused controversy because of the rise in the discourse of the ban on veils and circumferential pants in government agencies. Komnas HAM reminded about the right to express attributes in accordance with the religion that is believed.
"I just want to remind state officials that the state's obligation is to respect and protect individual human rights and independence, including freedom to express what he believes to be the teachings of his religion," Komnas HAM Chairman Ahmad Taufan Damanik told reporters on Sunday (3/11/2019) .
Taufan explained that the right to express belief is indeed not an absolute human right. Nevertheless, regulatory regulations on it must be based on strong reasons.
"Individual independence in this case the freedom to express belief is indeed not an absolute human right. However, the regulation for its regulation and limitation must be based on strong reasons. In international standards, the Siracusa Principles are known," he said.
To note, the Siracusa principle is the limitation or reduction of human rights carried out on the basis of national moral safety considerations. It could also be for reasons of national safety and security or the equivalent.
